title: Just a question
body:
Why don't new skins go on sale anymore?

I remember Riot making a post about how 1350 skins wouldn't go on sale on release anymore. I cant remember what excuse they gave at the time, but I don't remember anything being said about 1820+ skins not having release sales anymore...

Yet no legendary (or ultimate) skin released in ages has had an on-release discount.

Im not moaning about the price of skins, I'm just wondering why they stopped going on sale?

replies.body:
> Why don't new skins go on sale anymore?

Money.

Money, money, money.

Money, money, money, money, money, money, money, money, money, money.

######Ever notice how a word loses all meaning if you say it enough? Though, I suppose it doesn't lose it's value.
This is so deep that it's so true.

I had to do a bit of digging for this, but I've finally found out why ;)

'Initial discounts' were replaced with the 'early sales' system we have now. In the [announcement post](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/store/sales/were-changing-discounts) they said this:

+ _"Bringing all of our skins onto the same early sale schedule means there will no longer be a launch sale for 1350s and Ultimates starting in the new year"_

You also said that 1820 RP skins used to have initial discounts, but I'm 99% sure this never happened. Even in the same 'early sales' announcement they say:

+ _"We also want players to have a chance to get a deal on skins of any tier, which conflicts with the fact that **we previously didnâ€™t discount legendary skins (1820s)**. So we're making future Legendary skins eligible for the early sale..."_

I hope that helps!

Project Yi was discounted 1 week after release _(but you didnt get the border)_
im certain they used to have discounts..

Also, im not a fan of the early sales.. Half of the time the skin doesn't even go on sale. :(

1820 RP skins may have had sales before 2013 when [this](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=3328361&highlight=price+change) decision was made, are you referring to that maybe?

But no 1820 RP skin has gone on sale since then, Project Yi included. He stayed at 1820 RP in both the First Strike (the one with borders) and Second Strike/Week Two promotion.

https://i.gyazo.com/278f86241240e6e799cc7bf92bfc4b88.png
[Source](http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-pbe-feedback/3qXbIdqV-initializing-project-first-strike-project-sync)

I gotta agree though, I'm not much of a fan of the early sales either XD Waiting 4/6 months for a small sale is pretty lame IMO.

Oh, i must be mistaken... i could have sworn tho..

Yea the early sales are annoying, i waited ages for heartseker orianna to go on sale, then the sale finally came up, and Sweetheart Sona was on the list and Ori wasnt...

I gave up waiting for sales after that, i just buy all the skins i want on release now...
why do u buy rp tho

I think it's fair because 1350 skins basically turned into 975RP skins. They added this new tier price, but it was like they were worried players would hate them, so they made it that every 1350RP skin would be 975RP for a short while after release. 


That basically means most people were buying all those 1350RP skins at 975RP. I know not all people bought the skins at that time, but people are pretty desperate to get skins at release *cough* Lux skin *cough*. 

So yeah it's most likely money, but also the people working on these skins, some 1350RP skins are pretty close to the 1820RP tier, say Santa Braum for example, that just needs voice lines and it's ready to go, he rides a sleigh when homeguard boost! So much work has gone into it. It would be sad if most of the LoL players bought that for 975RP straight up.

I'm really just putting a different perception because I do know games like League of Legends are money hungry, but yeah. Also, with the change they made, they made it so legendary skins would go on sale now, so that was like a plus to all this sale change. Especially since they come out more often than Ultimate skins.
